wisdom_insights.summary: In high-conversion workflows, replicating a proven template (Todd's OTO page) with exact typography, colors, and structure tends to preserve performance and avoid regressions caused by superficial changes.

Constantly observe asset integrity (hero image presence, font sizing, color palette) and promptly decide to revert to or copy proven assets when deviations threaten conversions; act by updating HTML/CSS to align with the reference.
All changes and decisions are anchored to the origin: the original Unbounce/Todd pages and the supplied content. This ensures traceability and defensibility of design choices.
Capturing Senses, Actions, Emotions, Impulses, Cognitions (S.A.E.I.C.) reveals tensions between aesthetic fidelity and functional constraints (e.g., missing hero image, asset URLs).
Maintaining the established page voice (conversational, direct, conversion-focused) is critical to sustaining audience trust and conversions across sections.

attractors.name: Conversion Fidelity Momentum
attractors.description: Momentum built by strict fidelity to a known high-performing layout and copy; slipping fidelity reduces perceived trust and CTR.

attractors.name: Asset Completeness Urgency
attractors.description: Missing hero image and font/size mismatches drive urgency to hunt for exact assets and restore the original look.

attractors.name: Proven Template Reliance
attractors.description: Reliance on Todd's OTO structure as a baseline, resisting ad-hoc redesigns to avoid destructive divergence.

attractors.name: Provenance-Backed Decision Making
attractors.description: Decisions are guided by origin-content (Stop-Replaying page, Todd's page) to ensure traceable, justifiable changes.

attractors.name: Voice-Consistency Drive
attractors.description: Maintaining a consistent brand voice across blocks aligns with prior successful messaging.

wisdom_insights: MOSAEIC Transformational Principle

MOSAEIC is positioned as a transformation mechanism that rewrites root learning at the neural level, not just a set of coping strategies. This contrasts with counteractive approaches (CBT, affirmations, mindfulness) which tend to overlay new content onto old learning and risk relapse because the original implicit memory remains active.
High
Active Awareness as Core Mechanism

MOSAEIC uses Active Awareness across the five windows (Senses, Actions, Emotions, Impulses, Cognitions) to surface latent patterns. This explicit, experiential access makes it possible to generate a genuine prediction error within a labile window, enabling reconsolidation-driven change.
High
Five Windows as Diagnostic Engine

The MOSAEIC Five Windows provide a structured diagnostic map that reveals the hidden architecture of the 'operating system' running behavior, making it tractable to design a precise mismatch experience that leads to durable change.
High
Branded Mechanism vs Generic Neuroscience

Positioning MOSAEIC as the branded mechanism (not vanilla memory reconsolidation) clarifies differentiation, helps protect intellectual property, and aligns with the target analytical mind that needs clear, concrete mechanistic language.
High
Historical-Provenance Framing

Grounding claims in the historical science (neuroplasticity, memory reconsolidation) while highlighting the transformative rewrite at the source helps preempt skepticism and builds trust with evidence-oriented clients.
Medium-High
Outcome-Focused Framing (Fulfillment + Agency)

The narrative shifts from merely reducing symptoms to restoring agency and inner fulfillment—addressing both the internal experience and the practical capability to act without fighting with one's own 'operating system.'
High

wisdom_insights.name: Localize external resources
wisdom_insights.summary: After fetching a page, convert all external references (CSS, JS, fonts, images) to local paths to create a self-contained page that loads reliably on any host.

wisdom_insights.name: Stepwise, repeatable migrations
wisdom_insights.summary: Break complex migrations into a fixed sequence (collect assets, update HTML, migrate CSS/JS, test) to reduce errors and enable reuse for future pages.

wisdom_insights.name: Remove noise to improve performance and privacy
wisdom_insights.summary: Strip tracking and platform-specific scripts (e.g., Unbounce tracking) to avoid bloat and privacy concerns while debugging.

wisdom_insights.name: Convert absolute-positioned designs to responsive layouts
wisdom_insights.summary: Recognize that Unbounce-style absolute positioning is not mobile-friendly; prioritize a responsive refactor using modern CSS (flexbox/grid) or platform-native sections.

wisdom_insights.name: Template-driven migration kits
wisdom_insights.summary: Provide a ready-to-use folder structure and templates (e.g., ghl_css.css, ghl_html.html, ghl_instructions.txt) to speed up future migrations and ensure consistency.

wisdom_insights.name: API/tooling constraints drive automation design
wisdom_insights.summary: When direct API access is unavailable or limited, design automation around manual steps and scripts, and clearly present options to users.

key_themes: Handling API limitations with practical workarounds
reasoning: The extraction focused on recurring strategies and practical guidelines embedded in the conversation: localizing assets, breaking work into repeatable steps, removing tracking, designing for responsiveness, and accommodating API/tooling constraints with user-friendly automation options.

wisdom_insights.name: Specification-Driven Design
wisdom_insights.summary: Treat formal specifications as the source of truth to drive architecture and reduce ambiguity.

wisdom_insights.name: Modular Pipeline Mental Model
wisdom_insights.summary: Decompose cognition/processing into a deterministic, well-defined pipeline (e.g., LangGraph 6-node) to improve clarity and testability.

wisdom_insights.name: Single Source of Truth for Tech Stack
wisdom_insights.summary: Consolidate database strategy and architectural decisions to avoid conflicting narratives (e.g., Neo4j-only).

wisdom_insights.name: Stability by Default
wisdom_insights.summary: Freeze environments/dependencies to prevent drift and flaky builds (e.g., NumPy 2.0 frozen).

wisdom_insights.name: Triage-Driven Hygiene
wisdom_insights.summary: Structure health checks into categories: what's good, what's broken, what's misaligned, what's fake; use to guide remediation.

wisdom_insights.name: Preserve Proven Implementations
wisdom_insights.summary: Archive clean implementations to maintain recoverability and knowledge persistence.

wisdom_insights.name: Reality-Check for Documentation
wisdom_insights.summary: Keep docs aligned with reality; resolve contradictions and obsolete references (e.g., Docker vs Docker-independent claims).

wisdom_insights.name: One-Truth Documentation
wisdom_insights.summary: Maintain a single, coherent narrative for architecture and deployment to prevent confusion.

wisdom_insights.name: Align Architecture with Specs
wisdom_insights.summary: Base architectural decisions on formal specs; defer ad-hoc changes that violate them.

wisdom_insights.name: Consolidate Tech Stack Choices
wisdom_insights.summary: Choose a single, documented approach (e.g., Neo4j-only) and deprecate conflicting narratives.

wisdom_insights.name: Documentation Hygiene as Priority
wisdom_insights.summary: Regularly consolidate and audit docs; fix hardcoded paths and flaky references in tests.

wisdom_insights.name: Environment Stewardship
wisdom_insights.summary: Freeze and lock down dependencies and environments to reduce drift and stabilize builds.

wisdom_insights.name: Risk Triage and Remediation
wisdom_insights.summary: Systematically address 'broken' and 'pretends to work' items to reduce risk exposure.

wisdom_insights.name: ARCHON-FIRST RULE
wisdom_insights.summary: Critical dependencies (Archon MCP) must be online for any task management workflow; operations should abort and require remediation if unavailable.

wisdom_insights.name: Dependency gating / prerequisites
wisdom_insights.summary: Proceed only after verifying essential systems/resources (OpenSpec availability, Archon connection) to avoid wasted effort.

wisdom_insights.name: Tool capability discovery as gating
wisdom_insights.summary: Verify tool availability (e.g., OpenSpec) before attempting task-related actions; use capability checks to scope actions.

wisdom_insights.name: Fail-fast with clear blockers
wisdom_insights.summary: If a critical service is unavailable, stop, report the blocker, and avoid proceeding with dependent workflows.

wisdom_insights.name: Explicit remediation guidance
wisdom_insights.summary: When blocked, provide concrete next steps to restore capability (check config, restart service, re-connect).

wisdom_insights.name: Gated workflow design
wisdom_insights.summary: Structure workflows so that progress is contingent on essential systems; encode gating rules (e.g., Archon must be connected).

reasoning: Extracted recurring patterns of gating critical dependencies (Archon), verifying tool availability (OpenSpec), and providing remediation steps; captured action guidelines and decision frameworks for when systems are unavailable.

wisdom_insights.name: Pattern vs Willpower
wisdom_insights.summary: Entrenched behaviors run at subconscious speeds far beyond conscious effort; changing the pattern requires addressing deeper cognitive architecture rather than relying on discipline alone.

wisdom_insights.name: Memory Reconsolidation
wisdom_insights.summary: Emotional learnings can be erased at the neural level by triggering reconsolidation with the right signal, yielding lasting change rather than mere coping.

wisdom_insights.name: Mismatch Experience / Prediction Error
wisdom_insights.summary: A mismatch between expectation and reality opens a neural window for updating beliefs, enabling the brain to rewrite patterns.

wisdom_insights.name: Foundational Architecture vs Surface Change
wisdom_insights.summary: True change targets the core cognitive architecture, not just surface habits or strategies, leading to durable transformation.

wisdom_insights.name: Safety Beliefs as Survival
wisdom_insights.summary: Beliefs are held because they feel safe; altering them requires re-safety signaling and alignment with the brain's needs, not just logical argument.

wisdom_insights.name: Conscious vs Unconscious Processing Pace
wisdom_insights.summary: Conscious processing (~40 bits/sec) is dwarfed by unconscious processing (~40 million bits/sec). Effective change must engage the unconscious systems.

wisdom_insights.name: Three-Phase Change Protocol
wisdom_insights.summary: Phase 1 Schema Reactivation & Mapping; Phase 2 Prediction Error Generation; Phase 3 Adaptive Reconsolidation to rewrite patterns.

wisdom_insights.name: Target Foundational Architecture
wisdom_insights.summary: Design change programs that aim at core cognitive structures, not only symptoms or behaviors.

wisdom_insights.name: Create Mismatch Experiences
wisdom_insights.summary: Deliberately create scenarios where old beliefs are contradicted to trigger updating during the reconsolidation window.

wisdom_insights.name: Prioritize Non-conscious Interventions
wisdom_insights.summary: Favor interventions that engage unconscious neural processes over mere willpower or surface-level tactics.

wisdom_insights.name: Environment-first verification
wisdom_insights.summary: Always verify system status, active tasks, and repository context before acting.

wisdom_insights.name: Option framing for scope control
wisdom_insights.summary: Present bounded next steps to reduce decision paralysis and focus effort.

wisdom_insights.name: Context-aware scoping
wisdom_insights.summary: Differentiate between codebase vs media/archive content to avoid misaligned work.

wisdom_insights.name: Pre-action scoping ritual
wisdom_insights.summary: Do quick scoping checks (status, tasks, location) before starting work to ensure relevance and alignment.

wisdom_insights.name: Communicate health upfront
wisdom_insights.summary: Provide a concise health check to surface what's working, what's not, and recommended next steps.

wisdom_insights.name: Media directory is not code

wisdom_insights.name: Free Energy Principle as System North Star
wisdom_insights.summary: System minimizes variational free energy F = Accuracy + Complexity; precision weighting acts as inverse temperature, guiding belief updates and learning rates.

wisdom_insights.name: Hierarchical Predictive Processing
wisdom_insights.summary: Information flows through a five-layer hierarchy (Sensory to Metacognitive) with bottom-up errors and top-down predictions, using precision-weighted errors to drive learning.

wisdom_insights.name: Global Workspace as Consciousness Engine
wisdom_insights.summary: Winner-take-all competition among layers with coalition formation; consciousness emerges from high activation and variance in competition, enabling cross-layer information integration.

wisdom_insights.name: Modular, Reusable Architecture for Renormalising Generative Models (RGM)
wisdom_insights.summary: Design with clearly delimited components (ThoughtSeed, LayerState, GlobalWorkspaceState) and serialization/persistence to enable straightforward adaptation to RGM tasks.

wisdom_insights.name: Adaptive Belief Updating with Per-Layer Learning Rates
wisdom_insights.summary: Coordinate posterior updates via a BeliefStateManager using per-layer learning rates, convergence criteria (last 100 updates, 0.05 threshold), and stability metrics to ensure robust convergence.

wisdom_insights.name: Structured Validation and Metrics-Driven Development
wisdom_insights.summary: Leverage extensive tests and metrics (convergence, coherence, energy metrics) and CLI tools for validation, ensuring correctness and reproducibility.

wisdom_insights.name: From Proving to Being
wisdom_insights.summary: Shift identity and motivation from external validation through achievement or caregiving to an authentic state of being; align actions with inner transformation rather than performance metrics.

wisdom_insights.name: Pattern Recognition & Replacement (Replay Loop)
wisdom_insights.summary: Identify recurring cognitive patterns (replay loops) and replace them with deliberate, intentioned alternatives; move from diagnosis to proactive change.

wisdom_insights.name: Obstacles-to-Solutions Framing
wisdom_insights.summary: Structure problem-solving by first outlining obstacles, then delivering a single, structured solution, supported by a case study and measurable deliverables.

wisdom_insights.name: Recognition–Reframe–Permission–Direction
wisdom_insights.summary: Emotional-journey framework guiding learners: recognize the struggle, reframe it, normalize it, provide a direct path, and offer affirmation.

wisdom_insights.name: From X to Y Transformation Language
wisdom_insights.summary: Use explicit transformation phrasing (From X to Y) to communicate progress and change in a tangible way.

wisdom_insights.name: Time-Bounded, Concrete Practice Units
wisdom_insights.summary: Design practices with clear time constraints (e.g., 2/5/10 minutes) and measurable deliverables to enable execution and momentum.

wisdom_insights.name: Three-Obstacle, One-Solution Pattern
wisdom_insights.summary: For each challenge, present three obstacles and a single, structured solution, anchored by a case study and explicit deliverables.

wisdom_insights.name: Direct Reader Address as Engagement Engine
wisdom_insights.summary: Maintain direct 'you' language to foster intimacy, accountability, and personalized relevance.

wisdom_insights.name: Contrarian Framing Grounded in Neuroscience

wisdom_insights.name: End-of-Lesson Deliverables & Next Steps

wisdom_insights.name: Case-Study-Driven Learning
wisdom_insights.summary: Anchor lessons in named, industry-specific case studies to ground concepts in real-world context.

wisdom_insights.name: Layered Metaphor Use for Cognition
wisdom_insights.summary: Weave multiple, complementary metaphors (architecture, light, biology, growth) to scaffold understanding and retention.

wisdom_insights.name: Capability Boundary Mapping
wisdom_insights.summary: Always map user requests to known capabilities; avoid promising features that don't exist; channel toward correct alternatives (MCP servers, slash commands).

wisdom_insights.name: Clarify-Then-Act Framework
wisdom_insights.summary: If an action is invalid or ambiguous, ask clarifying questions and pivot to feasible next steps rather than forcing the original request.

wisdom_insights.name: Prioritize with Explicit Task Order
wisdom_insights.summary: Triage work by explicit priorities (task_order), focusing on the top items first to manage workload and expectations.

wisdom_insights.name: Educate and Redirect on Architecture
wisdom_insights.summary: When a user asks for a non-existent feature, educate about the actual architecture (MCP, command files, settings path) and offer actionable next steps.

wisdom_insights.name: Clarity on Tool Capabilities Drives Efficiency
wisdom_insights.summary: Providing precise guidance about what exists and where to configure it reduces friction and miscommunication.

wisdom_insights.name: Modular Content Architecture
wisdom_insights.summary: Treat the manuscript as a modular system (front matter, phase blocks, lessons) to enable incremental assembly, validation, and replacement of placeholders without breaking the whole structure.

wisdom_insights.name: Proactive Gap Flagging
wisdom_insights.summary: If gaps or inconsistencies are detected (e.g., author placeholders or arc inconsistencies), flag for immediate remediation before delivery.

wisdom_insights.name: Representational Redescription (SOMA) as upgrade
wisdom_insights.summary: Memory and experience are rewritten by adding context, modularity breaks, and agency, converting a 'replay' into a richer, more capable representation rather than erasing past patterns.

wisdom_insights.name: Replay loops as stuck simulations
wisdom_insights.summary: The brain runs fixed-parameter simulations (replays) that repeat patterns until intentional interventions reframe meaning and context, enabling progress rather than eradication of the loop.

wisdom_insights.name: Affect labeling reduces amygdala activation
wisdom_insights.summary: Naming or labeling emotions helps dampen emotional reactivity, creating space for cognitive processing and adaptive action.

wisdom_insights.name: Memory reconsolidation as enhancement
wisdom_insights.summary: Memories are not erased but upgraded or reorganized with added complexity and context, improving future responses.

wisdom_insights.name: Upgrade over erase
wisdom_insights.summary: The contrarian insight that progress comes from enriching the existing pattern with context and agency rather than trying to suppress or delete it.

wisdom_insights.name: Three-step Replay Loop Breaker

wisdom_insights.name: Phase-driven narrative structure

wisdom_insights.name: Compassionate, permission-giving voice as enabler

wisdom_insights.name: Externalize to create new emotional reference points

wisdom_insights.name: Ownership of the upgrade metaphor

wisdom_insights.name: Maya as a stable anchor for applying theory
wisdom_insights.summary: Using a concrete character with a specific belief and scenario helps translate complex mechanisms into actionable steps.

wisdom_insights.name: Offer a structured, time-efficient pathway for high-achievers
wisdom_insights.summary: Design programs that are concise, practical, and respect the user’s cognitive load; map content to memory reconsolidation-style change to reduce duration of effort and increase perceived progress.

wisdom_insights.name: Address objections with risk-reversal and evidence
wisdom_insights.summary: Mitigate resistance by offering a 30-day guarantee and strong testimonials; frame skeptics’ concerns as solvable with structure and evidence rather than more introspection.

wisdom_insights.name: Niche positioning for depth with pragmatism
wisdom_insights.summary: Target 'high-achieving, intellectually gifted professionals' who seek depth plus structure; market as 'spiritually curious but pragmatically grounded' to balance meaning and evidence.

wisdom_insights.name: Transformation framing: inner shift first, outer expression second
wisdom_insights.summary: Communicate that inner alignment enables authentic leadership and effortless external outcomes, rather than pushing for more performance-driven behavior.

key_themes: Architecture-first change: upgrade internal systems to remove ceilings
Nervous system as governor: reframe patterns as protective, not personal failures
Authenticity as a leadership advantage: presence over performative success
Structured, evidence-based path for exhausted high-achievers

wisdom_insights.name: Unified base with type-specific extensions
wisdom_insights.summary: All memory types share a common base (memories) and extend via type-specific tables. This enables unified vector search, consistent decay/importance rules, and transactional integrity across disparate cognitive functions.

wisdom_insights.name: Exponential forgetting with per-item tunable decay

wisdom_insights.name: Exponential forgetting with adjustable decay
wisdom_insights.summary: Relevance is calculated as importance × e^(−decay_rate × age_in_days); uses an Ebbinghaus-like curve to model forgetting with per-item decay customization.

wisdom_insights.name: Testing effect with logarithmic growth
wisdom_insights.summary: Memory access increases importance via a log-based scaling: new_importance = old_importance × (1 + ln(access_count + 1) × 0.1), capturing diminishing returns and reinforcement from repetition.

wisdom_insights.name: Bounded growth via log scaling
wisdom_insights.summary: Logarithmic growth prevents runaway inflation of importance, ensuring stability and realism in long-term scoring.

wisdom_insights.name: Memory lifecycle staging
wisdom_insights.summary: A clear lifecycle: working_memory (transient) → consolidation to memories → clustering → archival; explicit expiry avoids unbounded storage and mirrors cognitive consolidation.

wisdom_insights.name: Computed storage for dynamic scoring
wisdom_insights.summary: relevance_score is a generated/stored field recalculated on access to reflect current age and importance, enabling efficient queries while staying dynamic.

wisdom_insights.name: Cognitive science mapping
wisdom_insights.summary: Direct mapping to forgetting curve, spacing effect, and testing effect; parameters are tunable to align model behavior with cognitive principles.

strategic_principles.name: Prefer log-based reinforcement for accessibility
strategic_principles.summary: Use logarithmic growth in importance to model diminishing returns and keep scores stable over many accesses.

strategic_principles.name: Explicit expiry for working memory
strategic_principles.summary: Assign expiry timestamps to transient data and consolidate into long-term storage to emulate cognitive consolidation.

strategic_principles.name: Separate lifecycle layers

strategic_principles.name: Derive relevance on access and age

strategic_principles.name: Validate with targeted tests
strategic_principles.summary: Use tests to verify decay vs age and growth vs access to ensure the model behaves as intended and aligns with cognitive principles.

key_themes: Testing effect and spacing in memory management

Dynamic relevance scoring for clustering and archival

wisdom_insights.name: E5 Framework (copywriting framework)
wisdom_insights.summary: A structured, criteria-based approach to copy: Big Idea, Unique Mechanism, Headline, Lead, Offer, Proof, etc. Emphasizes Four U headline testing, credible proof, and education-first selling.

wisdom_insights.name: Unique Mechanism / Identity Thermostat
wisdom_insights.summary: Use a branded mechanism to explain why change is hard and to differentiate from alternatives; makes invisible processes visible and teachable.

wisdom_insights.name: Four U Test (headline quality gate)
wisdom_insights.summary: Headlines should be Ultra-specific, Unique, Useful, and Urgent. It’s a critical gate for persuasion; failing it weakens the entire page.

wisdom_insights.name: Education-Based Marketing (educate before selling)
wisdom_insights.summary: Teach the mechanism and why past methods fail before presenting the offer, establishing credibility and belief.

wisdom_insights.name: Category Creation

strategic_principles.name: Lead with mechanism and proof after claim
strategic_principles.summary: Front-load the mechanism (Identity Thermostat / PIR) and then anchor claims with proof and case studies to satisfy 'proof' requirement.

strategic_principles.name: Structure offers with stacked value
strategic_principles.summary: Bundle core program with bonuses, price anchor, and a clear risk reversal; sell each bonus with emotional benefits; create urgency by scarcity and deadlines.

strategic_principles.name: Prove claims and provide concrete outcomes
strategic_principles.summary: Provide numbers, case studies, testimonials, before/after data to support claims; avoid 'education-only' claims without receipts.

strategic_principles.name: Clarify credibility early in lead
strategic_principles.summary: Introduce credentials or track record upfront, so readers trust the argument before proof later.

strategic_principles.name: Differentiate from mainstream approaches
strategic_principles.summary: Explicitly contrast with shadow work, energy healing, etc., to justify the new mechanism and ensure perceived novelty.

key_insights.summary: A branded mechanism (Identity Thermostat) is powerful for both explanation and differentiation; it reveals why previous attempts fail by pointing to automatic alignment forces.
Without strong proof, even strong mechanisms risk being dismissed; prospects crave numbers, testimonials, and concrete transformations.
Headline quality is a gating factor; Four U compliance determines whether the reader engages; a weak headline undermines the entire page.
Category labels (Analytical Empaths) create a tight audience identity and set expectations; helps audience self-select and reduces perceived generic coaching risk.
Education-first marketing builds belief, reducing skepticism and increasing perceived value before price negotiation.

reasoning: I extracted recurring decision frameworks and actionable guidelines from the E5 critique, identifying the core mental models (E5 framework, Unique Mechanism, Four U). I then mapped strategic principles recommended by the critique (structure, proof, credibility, differentiation, offer stacking). Finally, I distilled key insights and themes that represent learnings about effective long-form sales copy in this context.

wisdom_insights.name: Iterative constraint-based tuning

wisdom_insights.name: Embrace diminishing returns on quality for social
wisdom_insights.summary: Since social platforms re-encode, prioritize practical file size and encoding speed over chasing ultra-high upstream quality; aim for mobile-friendly, easily-uploadable encodes.

wisdom_insights.name: Three-Level Cognitive Architecture (Base / First-Order Self-Model / Second-Order Self-Model)
wisdom_insights.summary: A hierarchical framework where the base level handles internal simulation using mental models, the first-order self-model adapts those models through plasticity, and the second-order self-model modulates the adaptation process via metaplasticity.

wisdom_insights.name: Hebbian Adaptation Principle
wisdom_insights.summary: Local synaptic updates follow hebμ(V1, V2, W) = V1V2(1-W) + μW, enabling strengthening of co-active representations and dynamic reweighting.

wisdom_insights.name: Metaplasticity (Second-Order Adaptation)

wisdom_insights.name: Counterfactual Thinking Model

wisdom_insights.name: Metacognitive Control Model (Multiple Representations)

strategic_principles.name: Use Metaplasticity to Stabilize Learning Dynamics

wisdom_insights.name: Hook lifecycle-oriented thinking
wisdom_insights.summary: Treat Claude Code hooks as lifecycle extension points. Use SessionStart for initialization (environment setup, persistent variables via CLAUDE_ENV_FILE); PreToolUse to enforce validation or gating before tool calls; PostToolUse for after-action hooks; SessionEnd for teardown. This framing clarifies where to place logic and how state flows through the agent's loop.

wisdom_insights.name: Align hook usage to desired control flow
wisdom_insights.summary: Choose hook types by outcome: SessionStart for initialization, PreToolUse for gating, and PostToolUse for post-action logic. Use the provided matcher patterns to scope hooks and leverage JSON or exit codes to influence Claude's decisions. Persist essential environment data via CLAUDE_ENV_FILE for cross-step continuity.

key_themes: Hook-driven configuration drives behavior across the agent lifecycle
SessionStart is for initialization; lacks a matcher and supports environment persistence
PreToolUse acts as a gatekeeper before tool execution; can block on failure
Environment variables CLAUDE_ENV_FILE and CLAUDE_PROJECT_DIR enable cross-step persistence
Matchers support exact, regex, wildcard patterns; defaults differ by hook type
Output control: exit codes and JSON allow steering flow and surface data

wisdom_insights.name: Emotional Fitness as Skill
wisdom_insights.summary: Treat emotional regulation, rumination control, and inner state management as trainable abilities rather than pathologies. Build through deliberate practice, measurable progress, and repeatable tools (not just talk therapy). This reframes suffering as something that can be sculpted into resilience and sustained performance.

wisdom_insights.name: Integration over Performance

wisdom_insights.name: Trojan Horse Copy Framework

wisdom_insights.name: Validation Hedonic Trap
wisdom_insights.summary: Identify the pattern of chasing external validation (dopamine from achievements) that never delivers lasting relief. Marketing and personal development should acknowledge this cycle and propose sustainable internal reinforcement rather than endless external rewards.

wisdom_insights.name: Proof through Peer Archetypes
wisdom_insights.summary: Credibility arises when testimonials come from peers who share status and context (CEOs, surgeons, founders). Combine data with narrative to bridge intellect and emotion, reinforcing applicability to their world.

wisdom_insights.name: Diagnosis-before-action
wisdom_insights.summary: Always assess current state, versions, and dependencies before attempting fixes. Use lightweight verification steps (pip show, dependency trees) to inform the plan.

wisdom_insights.name: Plan-then-execute with rollback
wisdom_insights.summary: Create an explicit plan with a rollback path upfront; test critical points; be prepared to revert if issues arise.

wisdom_insights.name: Minimal, safe changes
wisdom_insights.summary: Prefer the smallest, least risky modification that resolves the issue (e.g., downgrading numpy within bounds) rather than broad rewrites.

wisdom_insights.name: Dependency-bound strategy
wisdom_insights.summary: When pinning, prefer version ranges (e.g., numpy<2.0) to preserve compatibility with ecosystems that expect older APIs.

wisdom_insights.name: Downgrade numpy when no >=2 requirement exists
wisdom_insights.summary: If no package requires numpy>=2.0, install numpy<2 to regain compatibility with packages compiled against 1.x.

wisdom_insights.name: Test critical imports after changes
wisdom_insights.summary: Verify essential imports (SentenceTransformer, torch, custom GraphitiClient) to ensure the fix didn't break anything.

wisdom_insights.name: Update and document requirements
wisdom_insights.summary: Modify requirements.txt to reflect numpy version constraints and keep traceability for reproducibility.

wisdom_insights.name: Core compatibility insight
wisdom_insights.summary: SentenceTransformer 4.1.0 requires numpy 1.x; numpy 2.x causes import errors, driving the downgrade plan.

wisdom_insights.name: Observations on tooling compatibility
wisdom_insights.summary: PyTorch 2.8.0 is compatible with both numpy 1.x and 2.x, reducing risk on that axis; some auxiliary packages may be affected.

wisdom_insights.name: Module graph does not always depend on numpy
wisdom_insights.summary: GraphitiClient does not directly depend on numpy, but related modules do, informing the scope of impact.

wisdom_insights.name: Rollback viability
wisdom_insights.summary: Having a rollback plan (reinstall numpy==2.2.4 and force reinstall sentence-transformers) reduces risk if the fix backfires.

wisdom_insights.summary: Never let application code touch the database directly; route all data operations through a webhook layer (n8n) for security, auditing, and centralization.

wisdom_insights.name: Payload Contracts as API Surface
wisdom_insights.summary: Define and preserve payload shapes for create/get/search that downstream webhooks/workflows expect; treat payload contracts as the stable API.

wisdom_insights.name: 15-factor funnel-scoring engine
wisdom_insights.summary: Score 15 factors on a 1-5 scale; total score determines funnel length and template selection (higher = shorter funnel, lower = longer).

wisdom_insights.name: Proof-first design vs explanation
wisdom_insights.summary: Strong demonstrable proof compresses funnels; invisible/mechanistic proofs require longer copy and explanations.

wisdom_insights.name: Market awareness as foundation
wisdom_insights.summary: Prospect awareness level sets minimum funnel length; less awareness necessitates longer storytelling and education.

wisdom_insights.name: Traffic temperature as lever
wisdom_insights.summary: Cold traffic requires multi-step warm-up; warm traffic can often go straight to cart.

wisdom_insights.name: Risk/burden stacking increases funnel length
wisdom_insights.summary: High price, high perceived risk, low brand equity, or complex offers demand longer funnels to build trust.

wisdom_insights.name: Time-to-result matters
wisdom_insights.summary: Visible, rapid results enable demo-first formats; slow results require expectation-setting narratives.

wisdom_insights.name: Buying context sensitivity
wisdom_insights.summary: Mobile/short attention demands punchy, vertical formats; desktop supports deeper, longer-form content.

wisdom_insights.name: Iterative, one-factor-at-a-time optimization
wisdom_insights.summary: Use scoring to map to a template, then adjust one factor at a time (e.g., BNPL, stronger demo, more social proof) and test CVR lift.

wisdom_insights.name: Blue-ocean vs crowded market strategy
wisdom_insights.summary: In crowded markets preempt objections and differentiate; in blue oceans use curiosity hooks.

wisdom_insights.name: Decision-criteria per factor
wisdom_insights.summary: Each factor has explicit decision logic and funnel implications guiding the choice of format.

strategic_principles.name: Score-to-template mapping
strategic_principles.summary: Use the 15-factor score to select from four funnel templates (Lean, Medium, Long, Heavy) based on total points.

strategic_principles.name: Four template thresholds
strategic_principles.summary: 46+ points = Lean; 26-45 points = Medium; 26-45 points (long variant) = Long; ≤25 points = Heavy; apply context as needed.

strategic_principles.name: PDP vs VSL vs long-form vs presell rules
strategic_principles.summary: Apply practical guidelines for when to use PDP, VSL, webinars, quizzes/presells, short-form ads, and multi-day launches.

strategic_principles.name: Decision-iteration framework
strategic_principles.summary: Score factors, calculate total, map to template, adjust one factor at a time, test for CVR lift.

strategic_principles.name: Proof strategy guidance
strategic_principles.summary: Match proof type to factor context: strong demo for visuals; explanations for invisible proofs; tailor to risk and context.

strategic_principles.name: Compliance and risk gating
strategic_principles.summary: Account for regulatory load; apply KYC, pages, and additional gating when high compliance is required.

strategic_principles.name: Lifecycle economics
strategic_principles.summary: High LTV allows more education/nurture funnels; low LTV favors ROAS-first, tighter funnels.

strategic_principles.name: Acquisition friction optimization
strategic_principles.summary: Reduce payment friction to enable upsells; if high-friction payments exist, use gated funnels with trust copy.

strategic_principles.name: Urgency alignment
strategic_principles.summary: Higher urgency accelerates funnel pace; low urgency suggests longer, narrative-based content.

strategic_principles.name: Buying context adaptation
strategic_principles.summary: Tailor funnel to device/attention window; mobile requires concise formats; desktop supports deeper interactions.

wisdom_insights.name: Active Metacognition
wisdom_insights.summary: Shift from passive observation to active modulation where higher-level metacognitive processes influence lower-level beliefs by adjusting parameters such as precision and attention.

wisdom_insights.name: Precision-Weighted Inference
wisdom_insights.summary: Inference should be weighted by a precision (inverse variance) parameter, balancing uncertainty (entropy) and goal alignment (divergence) to shape exploration vs. exploitation.

wisdom_insights.name: Agency-driven Modulation
wisdom_insights.summary: Mental actions can target other agents' processing (precision) and focus (attentional spotlight) to orchestrate cross-agent behavior without altering content directly.

wisdom_insights.name: Prediction Error as Adaptation Trigger
wisdom_insights.summary: Use prediction error thresholds to drive hierarchical adaptation: low errors maintain status quo, moderate errors induce limited modulation, and high errors trigger stronger corrections.

wisdom_insights.name: Modular Registries for Coordination
wisdom_insights.summary: Maintain per-agent registries (precision, spotlight) to enable consistent cross-agent coordination and safe, traceable modulation.

strategic_principles.name: Explicit Mental Action Interfaces
strategic_principles.summary: Implement mental_action, _adjust_agent_precision, and _adjust_attentional_spotlight in the metacognition layer to control other agents.

strategic_principles.name: Threshold-Based Active Correction
strategic_principles.summary: Trigger active correction when prediction_error > 0.15; apply moderate delta for 0.15-0.30 and stronger delta for >0.30; optionally adjust attention.

strategic_principles.name: Precision-Weighted EFE
strategic_principles.summary: Incorporate a per-agent precision into EFE: EFE = (1/π) * H + π * D, enabling dynamic exploration-exploitation tradeoffs based on confidence.

strategic_principles.name: Per-Agent Precision Registry
strategic_principles.summary: Maintain precision bounds [0.01, 10.0] with per-agent registries to ensure stable modulation across agents.

strategic_principles.name: Cross-Agent Coordination via Registries
strategic_principles.summary: Use global registries for precision and attentional spotlight to coordinate multi-agent behavior coherently.

reasoning: Extracted recurring principles from the task description: elevate metacognition to actively steer other agents through precision and attention; formalize a precision-weighted inference and EFE; establish registries for cross-agent coordination; and apply threshold-based error-driven corrections.

wisdom_insights.name: Bayesian belief update (eta | s, a)
wisdom_insights.summary: Internal paths (mu) parameterize beliefs about external states (eta) via posterior Q_mu(eta) = P(eta | s, a); the agent selects mu by maximizing P(mu | s, a). This frames perception and action as evidence-guided belief revision.

wisdom_insights.name: Mean-field hierarchical factorization
wisdom_insights.summary: Beliefs factorize across levels: Q_mu(eta) ≈ Q_mu^(2)(eta) * Q_mu^(1)(eta), enabling beliefs about beliefs and tractable multi-level inference.

wisdom_insights.name: Marginal metacognitive belief
wisdom_insights.summary: Meta-beliefs about lower-level parameters arise by marginalizing over external and active variables, yielding higher-order beliefs (e.g., Q^(2)_mu^(2)(mu^(1))).

wisdom_insights.name: Sense of agency as statistical coupling
wisdom_insights.summary: Agency emerges from the joint distribution Q_mu^(2)(mu^(1), a^(1)) and is quantified by the divergence from independence; no-agency corresponds to independence between internal and active paths.

wisdom_insights.name: Agency strength via KL divergence
wisdom_insights.summary: D_KL[Q_joint || Q_mu^(2)(mu^(1)) * Q_mu^(2)(a^(1))] captures how tightly internal and active paths co-vary under beliefs; higher values indicate stronger sensed agency.

wisdom_insights.name: N-level hierarchical inference
wisdom_insights.summary: Beliefs compose across N levels (eta, mu^(1), ..., mu^(N-1)) with a unified cognitive core; deeper levels feed upper-level coherence of experience.

wisdom_insights.name: Precision as attention proxy
wisdom_insights.summary: Posterior precision (Pi) acts as an attention mechanism; higher-level controllers modulate lower-level precision to gate belief updates.

wisdom_insights.name: Phenomenological computations in Bayesian terms
wisdom_insights.summary: Sense of separation, duality, and non-dual modes are framed as structures within internal/external joint distributions and self-representation.

wisdom_insights.name: Empirical testability via KL and Markov blankets
wisdom_insights.summary: KL divergence correlates with agency-related behaviors; nested Markov blankets provide identifiable structure for timeseries dynamics and mental actions.

key_themes: Agency as statistical relation between internal and active states
Structural organization via nested Markov blankets and hierarchical priors

wisdom_insights.name: Declarative vs Procedural Metacognition
wisdom_insights.summary: Declarative metacognition is knowledge about the mind (semantic), while procedural metacognition is real-time monitoring and control (experiential). They form two layers (informational vs regulatory) with language dependence differences; procedural metacognition can operate independently of language and even in non-human animals.

wisdom_insights.name: Metacognitive Feelings as Signals
wisdom_insights.summary: Metacognitive feelings (e.g., Aha!, Tip-of-the-Tongue) act as non-conceptual signals bridging unconscious processing and conscious regulation, signaling epistemic gain and guiding transitions from automatic to controlled thought.

wisdom_insights.name: Flight Manual vs Pilot Analogy
wisdom_insights.summary: Declarative metacognition is like studying a flight manual (theory); procedural metacognition is the act of piloting (monitoring and control), with metacognitive feelings serving as the experiential cues that prompt action.

wisdom_insights.name: Agency through Attentional vs Cognitive Control
wisdom_insights.summary: Conscious action is shaped by the interplay between Attentional Agency (focus management) and Cognitive Agency (deliberate rational control). Their balance governs how and when we act.

wisdom_insights.name: Psychedelic Amplification of Metacognition
wisdom_insights.summary: Psychedelic-assisted contexts may amplify metacognitive feelings, enabling profound shifts in perspective and psychological flexibility, often at the cost of disrupted top-down executive control.

wisdom_insights.name: Meditation as Procedural Metacognition Training
wisdom_insights.summary: Mindfulness and related practices train procedural metacognition by cycling between monitoring and control, gradually reshaping trait-level meta-awareness.

reasoning: Extracted explicit mental models and actionable patterns from the content: distinctions between declarative and procedural metacognition, signaling mechanisms (Aha!, Tip-of-the-Tongue), agency dynamics, and practical implications for memory-architecture design and therapeutic contexts.

wisdom_insights.name: Performance-first NLP pipeline
wisdom_insights.summary: Architect NLP analysis with latency bounds in mind, using batching, caching, and component reduction to meet sub-5-second goals for ~5k words.

wisdom_insights.name: Hybrid rule-based + validated ML approach
wisdom_insights.summary: Combine rule-driven patterns (e.g., PassivePy with spaCy) and validated literature benchmarks to achieve high accuracy where pure ML may underperform.

wisdom_insights.name: Evidence-based decision making

wisdom_insights.name: Cache-first to reduce repeated work
wisdom_insights.summary: Implement caching (e.g., syllable dictionaries, repeated pattern checks) to dramatically reduce per-document processing time and enable scaling.

wisdom_insights.name: Batch processing and pipeline tuning
wisdom_insights.summary: Use batch tokenization (nlp.pipe), disable unnecessary components, and optimize CPU-bound steps to maximize throughput.

wisdom_insights.name: Robust phrase matching via boundaries and case handling
wisdom_insights.summary: Use compiled, word-boundary regex with case-insensitive matching to minimize false positives in banned phrase detection.

wisdom_insights.name: Validated, maintainable dependencies
wisdom_insights.summary: Prefer maintained libraries (textstat, pyphen-like syllable tools, spaCy) with documented accuracy and compatibility across tools like Hemingway/Readable.

wisdom_insights.name: Bayesian Model Reduction (BMR) for offline structure learning
wisdom_insights.summary: Post-hoc comparison between a full and reduced generative model without new sensory data; decisions are driven by changes in free energy (ΔF) with pruning when the reduced model is favored; updates to Dirichlet concentrations redistribute beliefs via a' = a + a₀' - a.

wisdom_insights.name: Tri-level learning within Active Inference
wisdom_insights.summary: Three nested optimization processes: fast inference over hidden states, slower parametric learning of contingencies, and slow structure learning that reshapes the model itself; all aim to minimize variational free energy.

wisdom_insights.name: Expected Free Energy as a unifying objective
wisdom_insights.summary: Policies are selected to minimize expected free energy, balancing novelty/information gain (epistemic value), salience, and alignment with prior preferences (extrinsic value); drives an orderly exploration-to-exploitation shift.

wisdom_insights.name: Concepts as latent causes in a generative model
wisdom_insights.summary: Concept formation arises from learning latent causes that generate observable outcomes; concepts are encoded in likelihood mappings (A matrix) and refined across inference, parametric learning, and structure learning.

wisdom_insights.name: Structure learning and Occam’s window
wisdom_insights.summary: Favor simpler, well-supported models; prune unlikely structures using thresholds (e.g., ΔF and Occam's window) to prevent overfitting and promote generalization.

wisdom_insights.name: Offline consolidation and sleep-like pruning
wisdom_insights.summary: Structure learning operates offline (between engagements), akin to sleep-based consolidation and synaptic pruning, reducing complexity while preserving or enhancing knowledge representation.

wisdom_insights.name: Hebbian-like parametric learning via Dirichlet updates
wisdom_insights.summary: Edge/contingency strengths are updated with observed co-activations, implemented as a Dirichlet concentration update (a = a + s ⊗ o), embodying associative plasticity.

key_themes: Structure learning via Bayesian model reduction (BMR)
Active Inference and variational free energy optimization
Three-timescale learning: inference, parametric learning, structure learning
Epistemic vs pragmatic value and exploration-exploitation dynamics
Concept learning as latent-cause formation and equivalence learning

These map to both principled mental models and actionable strategies for agent design and knowledge-graph structure learning.
